circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: MP last seen on 09-04-2013 and was reported missing by his employer on 09-1-62013 after uncharacteristically not showing up for work.

May 3, 2012 family members reported seeing victim standing on the bank of the Rogue River, removing his shirt and shoes. He slipped on the wet smooth rocks and fell into the river which was running high and cold due to spring runoff. A short distance down river, victim's head was seen momentarily, before he was swept over a 12' waterfall. The victim was not seen again. Extensive search by SAR up to 7 miles downstream failed to recover victim.

The area below the falls is deeply undercut with multiple strong eddies and large submerged rocks with many unknown submerged pinning hazards. Due to turbulence, the visibility into the water was near zero.

County Search and Rescue searched both banks to approximately 7 miles downriver without success.

On November 22, 1967, Mr. Richard Henry Waters was last seen on a hiking trail in the Mt. Bachelor wilderness area by his wife, who had separated from Mr. Waters on the trail to head back to their car to determine if it was locked.  
  Mrs. Waters traveled back up the trail, but never found her husband or their family dog, who was accompanying them. 
 She went back to their vehicle, drove down the mountain road and summoned assistance from law enforcement officials.  Extensive search teams were deployed during the next few days; no sign of Mr. Waters was ever found.
The family dog was found alive 2 days later, approximately 1 mile away from the point of last contact.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Hyatt and his girlfriend, Kami Vollendroff (MP6781), were last seen at Boiler Bay State Park in Depoe Bay, Oregon on November 21, 2001. They were staying in an oceanfront condominium with Hyatt's grandparents.  At 10:00 a.m. they left the condominium, telling Hyatt's grandparents that they planned to look at the tide pools during the day. Neither Hyatt nor Volendroff has been heard from again.  Authorities believe the couple was swept out to sea and drowned.  A storm hit the area at around the time they vanished, and it is thought that they were dragged into the water by a powerful wave. One of Hyatt's shoes was discovered near Boiler Bay Cove several days after they vanished. The cove is a rocky inlet and is located less than one mile from the couple's last known location inside the park. Their bodies have never found.

Grant Schmidt's wife reported that he left home at 6:30pm on 4-7-1989 to visit friends in Beaverton but never made it to the friend's house. He did not show up for work on 4-10-89 and has not called any friends or family. His vehicle was abandoned on property off Burkhalter Road in Hillsboro, Oregon. A witness reported that on 4-7-89 at about 7:30 pm a black full-sized Chevrolet Blazer (Oregon License DPT752) drove up his 500-foot driveway. Before reaching the residence, the vehicle took off across the corner of the neighbor's property, crashing through the brush and coming to rest over the ridge against some vine maples. The driver left the scene and nobody at the residence was able to determine who the driver was. The vehicle was unlocked with the keys in the ignition.

Shane Sprenger has been missing since Tuesday, Nov 2nd, 2021. On the day of his disappearance, Sprenger, a contractor, was working at a job site near the Blue Sky Market in Blue River, Oregon. By numerous accounts, he returned a short distance to his home in Vida, OR at 10am for a lunch break and hasn't been seen since. His truck was located 2 days later near Blue River Reservoir by the friends and family to see him last and they then reported Sprenger as a missing person the following day on Friday, Nov 5th. It was initially reported that Sprenger was thought to be mushroom hunting but now is believed he intended to return to work to meet with a subcontractor and continue his work as he left his tools plugged in at the site.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Frauens left the Timberline Lodge at 10:00 a.m. on the morning of his disappearance to go snowshoeing on Mt. Hood, to the Hogback, at about 10,500 feet elevation.

He was last seen snowshoeing sometime that afternoon. He was supposed to return to his wife and sons at the lodge by 5:00 p.m. but never made it. His wife reported him missing at 6:00 p.m., and a search was initiated.

An extensive search of the Mount Hood area failed to find any sign of Frauens. He is an experienced hiker and marathoner and he has been to Mount Hood four times before, but he is not a mountaineer, and he has very little winter survival experience.

Frauens was poorly equipped for any extended period out in the weather and did not have a compass or any electronic devices, such as a cellular phone or mountain rescue unit, to assist in locating him. He was last seen carrying two apples and and a water bottle. In the days following his disappearance the weather was below freezing with some snow and occasional whiteout conditions.

A body was found in the Zigzag Canyon area of Mount Hood in early August 2003 that was wearing clothes similar to what Frauens was last seen wearing. Authorities initially announced that the remains were his, but they turned out to be wrong; Frauens is still missing. He is still believed to have died in the wilderness.

Frauens was employed as a sign painter at the time of his disappearance. He is originally from California; he moved with his family to Oregon in October 2002. His case remains unsolved.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: According to video surveillance:  On 5/25/2024 at 0557 hours, Edward Fredrickson parked his vehicle in a gravel parking lot near 200 N. Ross Street in the Empire area of Coos Bay.  Mr. Fredrickson exited his vehicle alone, walked around a fence, and headed out across an open grassy field owned by Sause Bros.  He walked in a northerly direction towards the water's edge/shoreline at low tide.  (At this point, Mr. Fredrickson disappeared from camera view)  It is likely that Mr. Fredrickson walked the shoreline in a north-easterly direction towards the North Bend Airport.  It is unknown what happened once he got to the shoreline.  Search and Rescue covered the ground in the area along with Coast Guard fly-overs and boat patrols.  It is feared that Mr. Fredrickson went into the water.

Jason Bjaranson was a deck hand on the Fishing Vessel "The Lady Cecelia" that sank approximately 17 miles off the coast of Southern Washington State on 03/10/2012. No flares or distress calls went out from The Lady Cecelia. The only indication that the boat had gone down was due to the Emergency Position Indicating Radio Beacon (EPIRB). A device mounted on the roof of a boat’s cabin that sends out a signal if it comes into contact with water. The ping hit the Coast Guard station at Warrenton, Oregon at 3:37 a.m. on Saturday and a Coast Guard helicopter found the slick and the life raft in less than two hours off. The United states Coast Guard conducted a search of 640 square miles but were unable to locate any survivors.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Ryan Staggs is the owner of Happy Motors in Newport, Oregon. He was last seen on 01-31-2022. Prior to his disappearance, on 08-08-2021, Staggs had been shot in the face while sleeping in his house by an unknown assailant. He survived the attack, was treated at a local hospital, and released. It is unknown if his disappearance is related to the shooting. Staggs’ vehicle was missing at the same time and later recovered and sold at auction. Staggs was not with the vehicle. (His vehicle was searched, and nothing was found to be of evidentiary value). Staggs’ whereabouts are unknown.

Anstess was on board a 44-foot catamaran, called the Cat Shot, when he disappeared off the coast of Oregon. Anstess, along with two other men, were in the process of delivering the catamaran from Cape Town, South Africa to Seattle, WA when they were caught up in a severe storm about 10 miles off the coast of Cape Blanco, OR.

David Rodman (MP 95950) is also still missing.

David Rojas last communicated via text message with family on 2-11-2023 at about 4:30 PM. Family reported him missing to law enforcement on 2-21-2023. A neighbor reported talking to Mr. Rojas on 2-11-2023 at about 10:30 PM. Mr. Rojas stated he was headed to a convenient store near his home for food and beverage. He left on foot. His house was found secure, with his pet and personal items inside.

Mandana left her home in Twisp, WA around July 22, 1984. She visited friends in Walla Walla, WA and then went to Wallowa County, Oregon to backpack into Hells Canyon National Recreation Area. She was not an experienced back packer. She planned to be gone 4-6 weeks. Her mother last heard from her on 08/02/1984. A worker at the Imnaha Cafe stated a female Forest Service employee gave Mandana a ride to Imnaha Road on 08/03/1984 or 08/04/1984. Mandana has never been heard from or seen again. She was reported missing to the Wallowa County Sheriff's Office on 09/27/1984. A package postmarked 08/04/1984 in the Tri-Cities (Richland/Pasco/Kennewick) WA was sent to Mandana's home address in Twisp. It was addressed to Mandana and it contained her driver's license, passport, and assorted personal notes.

Call history from Daniel Neasbitt’s phone shows he called several automotive repair shops before calling his son on 10/03/24. His phone did not make any calls after calling his son. The phone was powered off until 10/07/24. On 10/07/24 the phone pinged a cell tower east of Redmond WA. No calls were made from the phone. The phone had been powered off since then. circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Terry Rogers was last seen Memorial Day weekend in Bend, OR.  He had permission to be on a private campsite about a mile below Meadow Camp, southeast of Bend on the Deschutes River.  His campsite was below a bluff where he had parked his pickup truck. Two of his friends notified authorities when they failed to find him at the campsite on Tuesday evening May 29th, 1973.  His Truck with a bag of groceries in it was still parked on the bluff.  Down below at his campsite were his glasses, wallet, camping equipment, etc.,  but he was nowhere to be found.  Friends and members of the Deschutes County Search and Rescue unit had conducted a three-day search on foot, horseback and helicopter, but again he was nowhere to be found.  Terry lived and worked in the surrounding area and was attending Central Oregon Community College at the time.  He was an experienced camper and familiar with the terrain.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Thomas "Tommy" Richey left home to go fishing on the Rogue River on July 11, 1950. He liked to fish in an area where there was a cable car above the river that you could move to the middle and fish from above. His fishing pole as well as several fish he caught were found inside the cable car. He has not been seen or heard from since that day. The cable car was braked in the middle of the river which is why it was presumed something happened causing him to fall or jump and ultimately drown. The cable car and fishing hole are located 4 miles outside Prospect, Oregon on Mill Creek Lane and 6 miles upriver from the Lost Creek Dam.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Woody and his father, Jayson Thomas, were playing on the beach when a wave swept them out to sea.  Jayson's body was later found and identified but Woody has not been located.

Shoptaugh resided with her son in a residence on Highway 211 southeast in Estacada, Oregon at the time of her disappearance. 

Shoptaugh's son left with a friend at 7:30 a.m. to go mushroom hunting. When he returned four or five hours later, his mother was gone. Her brown 1985 Subaru station wagon with the Oregon license plate number CL 68605 was also missing. Shoptaugh has never been heard from again. Her son reported her missing on November 14.

On November 15, Shoptaugh's car was found on a forest service road in Mount Hood National Forest, four miles from Highway 224, east of Estacada. The vehicle was covered in black mold. The door was open and the keys were still in the ignition. The Forest Service employee who found it did not realize it was connected to a missing person.

On November 18, when the Forest Service realized the car was still parked in the same location, they did a computer inquiry to determine the owner's identity and realized it belonged to Shoptaugh and that she was missing. A search of the area was launched immediately.  Shoptaugh was never found.  Her case remains unsolved at this time.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Hall was last seen shortly after 2 p.m. September 30, 1983, at the Warrenton Mini-Mart in downtown by a boy who gave her a ride from the high school. She told the boy she was going to buy a soft drink and walk the half-mile to Warrenton Grade School, where she helped her aunt, a third-grade teacher. She never showed up.

Police from several agencies found no sign of the teen, despite exhaustive searches and interviews, including following hunches from psychics. Authorities suspected foul play. Hall was reliable and had a good relationship with her parents, she always let them know where she was. 

There is no reason to think she ran away. The night before her disappearance Hall had been elected the first female president of the Clatsop Co. Sheriff's Dept. Explorer Post.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Carried blue and white backpack and brown purse
Blue jeans and green hooded sweatshirt and blue jacket

 He had left all of his identification, including his badge as a retired policeman from Pasadena, California, on the kitchen counter of a home he was house-sitting for a friend who was vacationing in Arizona. He, also, left all of his credit cards.

A friend of his from Pasadena, CA, Police Department traveled to Mexico looking for him but had no success.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: On the morning of December 11, 2001 Bengt-Olov Sjoestroem and one of his business colleagues visiting from Sweden boarded and flew a small Mooney airplane from Seattle, Washington to Arcata, California. Several items from the plane belonging to Mr. Sjoestroem have been found along the beaches on the North Oregon Coast, but no remains have been identified as Bengt-Olov Sjoestroem.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Peter Bancarz is a Canadian citizen who lived outside of Sherwood, Oregon. On the afternoon of 12/28/1966, Peter's neighbors saw him drive away from his home in his car. The last confirmed sighting of Peter was at about 11:30pm when he left the Silver Skate Ice Arena in Portland, Oregon after playing in a league hockey game. A few days later his neighbors noticed Peter's car backed into his driveway and an associate of Peter's coming and going from Peter's house. On 04/15/1967, his brother reported Peter as a missing person. His family members had been unable to contact him since the end of December 1966. When contacted by Police, the associate claimed that he came to Peter's house on 12/29/1966 and they worked on Peter's car. The associate said that he came back the next day, but Peter wasn't home. The associate's explanation for Peter's disappearance was that he probably left to vacation in Hawaii and "many other places" with unknown friends from Canada. There was no indication, however, that Peter had left on a trip. Investigators found his passport, luggage, clothing, and other personal travel items were still in his home. 

It is believed that Peter Bancarz is likely a homicide victim, although his body has never been found.
